content.raw: Or if e.g. the cable plugging checkpoint is considered hard, we could give out more points for it regardless of how previous checkpoints were completed. In my understanding, per current rules, if I complete 3 checkpoints and they are no. 1 and 3 and 5, I get 3 points, while if they were no. 1 and 2 and 3, I get 6 points (because no skip is needed there). This seems like a pretty much random rewarding of checkpoints that happen to be in succession, regardless of actual complexity.
